00015 #include "point.h"

00018 
00019 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00020 // Describes one critical point inside cluster.
00021 // Critical point is a point laying on one of mirror axis where
00022 // there\'s a layer connected to one of the potencial points.
00023 // x,y -represent coordinates of point inside cluster.
00024 // layer - number of layer
00025 // kind - type of critical point
00026 
00027 class  CriPoint : public  Point
00028 {
00029     public :
00030      
00031       CriPoint():Point(){};
00032       CriPoint(int x,int y,layerType lay,unsigned int k):Point(x,y),
00033                            layer(lay),net(k){};
00034 #ifndef __MSDOS__
00035      ~CriPoint(){};
00036 #endif
00037 
00038   virtual classType       myNo() const { return CriPointClass; }
00039   virtual char           *myName() const  { return "CriPoint"; }
00040   virtual void            print( ostream& ) const;
00041   virtual int             isEqual( const Item& o) const 
00042                           {return ((CriPoint&)o).x == x && ((CriPoint&)o).y==y
00043                          && ((CriPoint&)o).layer == layer;}
00044 
00045     friend     List&      operator |=( List&,List&);
00046     friend     int        operator & ( List&,List&);
00047 
00048     
00049       
00050     // data members
00051       
00052 
00053       layerType  layer:6;      // layer number
00054       unsigned int net:4;      // critical "free"net identyfier (max 15 )
00055                            // 1 - means "constrained" net
00056 
00057 };
00058 
00059 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00060 //
00061 //  Critical net is such a net with is electrically connected 
00062 //  with one of critical points.There can be two kinds of them :
00063 //  1. constrained - two such nets connot meet together in critical point
00064 //              ( for example  in or out) always have id == 0
00065 //  2. free        - otherwise ( for example: vdd , vss)
00066 //  Constrained crit. nets can be user defined and are placed in static
00067 //  array which is a member of class Pattern
00068 //
00069 class  CriNet : public Item
00070 {
00071     public :
00072      CriNet(char *n ):name(n){};
00073                                 // Caution !! name should be canonized
00074 #ifndef __MSDOS__
00075      ~CriNet(){};
00076 #endif  
00077   virtual classType       myNo() const { return CriNetClass; }
00078   virtual char           *myName() const  { return "CriNet"; }
00079   virtual void            print( ostream& o) const 
00080                                   { o << "(" << name << ")";};
00081   virtual int             isEqual( const Item& o) const 
00082                           {return ((CriNet&)o).name == name ;}
00083 
00084    // data members:
00085 
00086     char *name;
00087 
00088 };
00089 
00090 
00091 #endif
